text: Ya know, we get a lot of comments
that are really nice and encouraging,
but my favorite comments by far -
the ones that get me MOST motivated
to keep.. creating for youtube -
are by far these ones here:
"I don't see your videos in my sub box anymore."
"If it wasn't for Twitter, I wouldn't be seeing your new videos."
"I came out of hiding to let you know that I DON'T see your videos anymore."
"What the fuck? I got notified of your upload by email,
I got home and can't find you in my sub box,
and you're not on suggestions. Great video,
by the way," he said. Appreciate that encouragement. I'm gonna need it.
"Good thing I have Twitter notifications on.
Video didn't appear in my sub box."
But when I got this message from Pewdiepie,
just a couple of days ago, he said
"YouTube's unsubbed me
from your channel. I just realized I haven't
seen your videos in a while. This is so fucked."
I mean, THAT'S encouraging.
That makes me really want to get out there,
and create videos for YouTube.
And then especially when you ask YouTube
what's up, and they tell you, "Oh, there's nothing
wrong," THAT feels good, too.
Cause then I know it's MY fault.
That was something I did wrong, and it's my shitty videos
that made Pewdiepie
